body_html: I don't think this is the same as #1199, and I'm not sure why pip upgrade doesn't overwrite /usr/local/bin/tensorboard -- it might be a permissions issue. Uninstalling the pip, removing /usr/local/bin/tensorboard and then reinstalling should solve the problem.
body_text: I don't think this is the same as #1199, and I'm not sure why pip upgrade doesn't overwrite /usr/local/bin/tensorboard -- it might be a permissions issue.  Uninstalling the pip, removing /usr/local/bin/tensorboard and then reinstalling should solve the problem.
body: I don't think this is the same as #1199, and I'm not sure why pip upgrade doesn't overwrite /usr/local/bin/tensorboard -- it might be a permissions issue.  Uninstalling the pip, removing /usr/local/bin/tensorboard and then reinstalling should solve the problem.
